greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = number of rational (0,1) matrices of rank k (n >= 0, 0 <= k <= n).
comment: Komlos and later Kahn, Komlos and Szemeredi show that almost all such matrices are invertible.
Table 3 from M. Zivkovic, Classification of small (0,1) matrices (see link). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 28 2006
reference: J. Kahn, J. Komlos and E. Szemeredi: On the probability that a random +-1 matrix is singular, J. AMS 8 (1995), 223-240.
J. Komlos, On the determinants of random matrices, Studia Sci. Math. Hungar., 3 (1968), 387-399.
link: M. Zivkovic, Classification of small (0,1) matrices, Linear Algebra and its Applications, 414 (2006), 310-346.
program: (PARI) T=matrix(5,5); { for(n=0,4, mm=matrix(n,n); for(k=0,n,T[1+n,1+k]=0); forvec(x=vector(n*n,i,[0,1]), for(i=1,n, for(j=1,n,mm[i,j]=x[i+n*(j-1)])); T[1+n,1+matrank(mm)]++); for(k=0,n,print1(T[1+n,1+k], if(k<n,",","; ")));) }
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 23 2001
ext: More terms and PARI code from _Michael Somos_, Sep 25, 2001
6 more terms from Lambert Klasen (Lambert.Klasen(AT)gmx.net), Dec 17 2004
